question: Do mice with Sirt1 deletion in SF1-expressing neurons show increased susceptibility to diet-induced obesity and insulin resistance? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Here, we show that mice lacking SIRT1 in steroidogenic factor 1 (SF1) neurons are hypersensitive to dietary obesity owing to maladaptive energy expenditure.
content.source_2: In contrast to previous reports, deletion of SIRT1 in SF1 neurons did not predispose mice to dietary weight gain; instead, energy expenditure increased and protected them from high-fat diet–induced obesity.
content.source_3: Also, mutant mice have increased susceptibility to developing dietary T2DM due to insulin resistance in skeletal muscle.
content.source_4: Targeted deletion of SIRT1 in SF1-expressing neurons did not precipitate insulin resistance; hyperinsulinemic–euglycemic clamp studies showed preserved skeletal muscle insulin sensitivity and no increase in diet-induced diabetes risk.
